speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: SCENE V. Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Enter CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS, and ALEXAS

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Give me some music; music, moody food

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Of us that trade in love.

speaker: Attendants
text_entry: The music, ho!

speaker: Attendants
text_entry: Enter MARDIAN

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Let it alone; let's to billiards: come, Charmian.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: My arm is sore; best play with Mardian.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: As well a woman with an eunuch play'd

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: As with a woman. Come, you'll play with me, sir?

speaker: MARDIAN
text_entry: As well as I can, madam.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: And when good will is show'd, though't come

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: too short,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: The actor may plead pardon. I'll none now:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Give me mine angle; we'll to the river: there,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: My music playing far off, I will betray

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Tawny-finn'd fishes; my bended hook shall pierce

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Their slimy jaws; and, as I draw them up,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I'll think them every one an Antony,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: And say 'Ah, ha! you're caught.'

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: 'Twas merry when

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: You wager'd on your angling; when your diver

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Did hang a salt-fish on his hook, which he

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: With fervency drew up.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: That time,--O times!--

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I laugh'd him out of patience; and that night

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I laugh'd him into patience; and next morn,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Ere the ninth hour, I drunk him to his bed;

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Then put my tires and mantles on him, whilst

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I wore his sword Philippan.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Enter a Messenger

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: O, from Italy

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Ram thou thy fruitful tidings in mine ears,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: That long time have been barren.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Madam, madam,--

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Antonius dead!--If thou say so, villain,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Thou kill'st thy mistress: but well and free,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: If thou so yield him, there is gold, and here

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: My bluest veins to kiss; a hand that kings

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Have lipp'd, and trembled kissing.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: First, madam, he is well.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Why, there's more gold.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: But, sirrah, mark, we use

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: To say the dead are well: bring it to that,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: The gold I give thee will I melt and pour

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Down thy ill-uttering throat.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Good madam, hear me.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Well, go to, I will;

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: But there's no goodness in thy face: if Antony

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Be free and healthful,--so tart a favour

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: To trumpet such good tidings! If not well,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Thou shouldst come like a Fury crown'd with snakes,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Not like a formal man.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Will't please you hear me?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I have a mind to strike thee ere thou speak'st:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Yet if thou say Antony lives, is well,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Or friends with Caesar, or not captive to him,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I'll set thee in a shower of gold, and hail

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Rich pearls upon thee.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Madam, he's well.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Well said.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: And friends with Caesar.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Thou'rt an honest man.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Caesar and he are greater friends than ever.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Make thee a fortune from me.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: But yet, madam,--

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I do not like 'But yet,' it does allay

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: The good precedence; fie upon 'But yet'!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: 'But yet' is as a gaoler to bring forth

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Some monstrous malefactor. Prithee, friend,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Pour out the pack of matter to mine ear,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: The good and bad together: he's friends with Caesar:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: In state of health thou say'st; and thou say'st free.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Free, madam! no; I made no such report:

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: He's bound unto Octavia.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: For what good turn?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: For the best turn i' the bed.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I am pale, Charmian.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Madam, he's married to Octavia.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: The most infectious pestilence upon thee!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Strikes him down

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Good madam, patience.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: What say you? Hence,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Strikes him again

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Horrible villain! or I'll spurn thine eyes

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Like balls before me; I'll unhair thy head:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: She hales him up and down

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Thou shalt be whipp'd with wire, and stew'd in brine,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Smarting in lingering pickle.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Gracious madam,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: I that do bring the news made not the match.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Say 'tis not so, a province I will give thee,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: And make thy fortunes proud: the blow thou hadst

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Shall make thy peace for moving me to rage;

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: And I will boot thee with what gift beside

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Thy modesty can beg.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: He's married, madam.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Rogue, thou hast lived too long.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Draws a knife

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Nay, then I'll run.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: What mean you, madam? I have made no fault.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Exit

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Good madam, keep yourself within yourself:

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: The man is innocent.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Some innocents 'scape not the thunderbolt.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Melt Egypt into Nile! and kindly creatures

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Turn all to serpents! Call the slave again:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Though I am mad, I will not bite him: call.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: He is afeard to come.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I will not hurt him.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Exit CHARMIAN

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: These hands do lack nobility, that they strike

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: A meaner than myself; since I myself

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Have given myself the cause.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Re-enter CHARMIAN and Messenger

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Come hither, sir.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Though it be honest, it is never good

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: To bring bad news: give to a gracious message.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: An host of tongues; but let ill tidings tell

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Themselves when they be felt.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: I have done my duty.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Is he married?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I cannot hate thee worser than I do,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: If thou again say 'Yes.'

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: He's married, madam.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: The gods confound thee! dost thou hold there still?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Should I lie, madam?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: O, I would thou didst,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: So half my Egypt were submerged and made

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: A cistern for scaled snakes! Go, get thee hence:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Hadst thou Narcissus in thy face, to me

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Thou wouldst appear most ugly. He is married?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: I crave your highness' pardon.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: He is married?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Take no offence that I would not offend you:

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: To punish me for what you make me do.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Seems much unequal: he's married to Octavia.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: O, that his fault should make a knave of thee,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: That art not what thou'rt sure of! Get thee hence:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: The merchandise which thou hast brought from Rome

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Are all too dear for me: lie they upon thy hand,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: And be undone by 'em!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Exit Messenger

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Good your highness, patience.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: In praising Antony, I have dispraised Caesar.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Many times, madam.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I am paid for't now.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Lead me from hence:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I faint: O Iras, Charmian! 'tis no matter.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Go to the fellow, good Alexas; bid him

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Report the feature of Octavia, her years,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Her inclination, let him not leave out

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: The colour of her hair: bring me word quickly.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Exit ALEXAS

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Let him for ever go:--let him not--Charmian,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Though he be painted one way like a Gorgon,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: The other way's a Mars. Bid you Alexas

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: To MARDIAN

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Bring me word how tall she is. Pity me, Charmian,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: But do not speak to me. Lead me to my chamber.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Exeunt
